description.narrative: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory based on an AIMM score of 40. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 46. The most significant, expected project-level outcomes are economy-wide benefits and employee skills development. Beyond the Project, IFC expects the investment to promote market competitiveness in Senegal via innovation and improved efficiency.

The proposed investment is up to a 165 million financing package to subsidiaries of the Omnium des Industries et de la Promotion Group (OIP or the Group), a leading cement producer in Morocco and West Africa, to finance (i) a greenfield integrated cement plant in Pout, Senegal; (ii) the addition of cement grinding capacity to an existing grinding station in Dio Gare, Mali; (iii) the addition of cement grinding capacity to an existing grinding station in Tema, Ghana (together, the Project). The Project will be implemented through Ciments de l'Afrique (CIMAF), the Groups sub-Saharan African subsidiaries, in each of Senegal, Mali and Ghana. The Project will expand clinker and cement capacity in West Africa to meet the growing demand for building materials across the subregion and to improve CIMAFs competitiveness. The IDA19 Private Sector Window Blended Finance Facility (IDA PSW BFF) may support this Project in Mali as described in the Blended Finance Section.
